title: Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve
summary: Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve is a U.S. national monument and national preserve in the Snake River Plain in central Idaho. It is along US 20 (concurrent with US 93 and US 26), between the small towns of Arco and Carey, at an average elevation of 5,900 feet (1,800Â m) above sea level. The protected area's features are volcanic and represent one of the best-preserved flood basalt areas in the continental United States.
